availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Wholesale dry goods merchant in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. Operated c1851-c1874. Owned by George Truman Jr., Joseph Price, Thomas Halloway, and John S. Weimer.

ab.bibl:
"Philadelphia and Suburbs: Mercantile Changes," The Philadelphia Inquirer (Philadelphia, PA), January 1, 1873, 3.
Edwin T. Freeley, Philadelphia and its Manufactures: A Hand-Book of the Great Manufacturies and Representative Mercantile Houses of Philadelphia, 1867 (Philadelphia: Edward, Young, and Co, 1867) 244.
